name: Astromeda Kickstarter Demo
description:
Astromeda is a story-driven, fast-paced & turn-based RPG inspired by Undertale, Celeste, and Hollow Knight where you explore the world, overcome hurdles and fight in a battle system that combines traditional turn-based actions with real-time attack dodging, similar to Metroidvania game bosses.

The music for the game is composed by Eric E. Hache!

Kickstarter Pre-launch wishlist page IS UP:

https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/astromeda/astromeda-story-driven-rpg

Combat

Fight enemies in a unique battle system that combines turn-based combat with fast-paced attack dodging!

Story

A prophecy was foretold across the Earth. It was said that an asteroid would collide with the planet in the next century. The prophecy, indeed, was true and the asteroid met its fate with Earth, leaving it empty and uninhabitable. After the destruction, a new bacteria was birthed from the ruins of the asteroid. Advanced in size and technology, it had the ability to duplicate itself into enormous numbers. As a result, a new race of thriving bacteria plagued the Earth, forming a peaceful colony. After a millennium, the Earth finally became habitable for human life once again. A group of four humans, sent out on a mission during the previous disaster returns to their home planet but in a terrible twist, crashes upon arrival - not knowing what is in store.

Exploration

Traverse through the world of Astromeda! Interact with unique NPCs, find hidden rooms, hidden bosses, items, hidden items, weapons, and much more!

Astromeda

Astromeda is being solo developed by me apart of the music which is composed by Eric E. Hache! which really takes a lot of time and effort! You can support me by following the game's social media and checking out the game's Kickstarter!

This demo takes place in the first area of the game and is only a small portion of what's planned for the final release!

Game's Twitter: https://twitter.com/astromeda_game

Discord: https://discord.com/invite/HwyB6XM

Devlog: https://forums.tigsource.com/index.php?topic=72515.0

Thank you!
